text.div:
Generated Narrative with Details

status: draft

date: 2-Sep 2014 5:51

publisher: HL7 FHIR Standard

group

linkId: CarePlan

title: Healthcare plan for patient

required: true

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

group

extension.valueString: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

This records identifiers associated with this care plan that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation). null
Identifies the patient/subject whose intended care is described by the plan. null
Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now just historical record. null
Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.
Identifies the most recent date on which the plan has been revised. null
Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan. null
Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.
Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care plan.  E.g. "Primary physician", "Team coordinator", "Caregiver", etc.
The specific person or organization who is participating/expected to participate in the care plan.
Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the Care Plan.

group.title: Desired outcome of plan
group.text: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.

extension.valueString: Human-readable description of a specific desired objective of the care plan. null
Indicates whether the goal has been reached and is still considered relevant. null
Any comments related to the goal.
The identified conditions that this goal relates to - the condition that caused it to be created, or that it is intended to address.
Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

group.title: Action to occur as part of plan

extension.valueString: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting. null
Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

group.text: not started | scheduled | in progress | on hold | completed | cancelled

extension.valueString: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan. null
Resources that describe follow-on actions resulting from the plan, such as drug prescriptions, encounter records, appointments, etc. null
Notes about the execution of the activity.
The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource. null

group.text: Activity details defined in specific resource

extension.valueString: A simple summary of details suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.
High-level categorization of the type of activity in a care plan. null

group.text: diet | drug | encounter | observation | procedure | supply | other

extension.valueString: Detailed description of the type of activity.  E.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.
The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur. null
Identifies the facility where the activity will occur.  E.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.
Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.
Identifies the food, drug or other product being consumed or supplied in the activity. null
Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day. null
Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied. null

This provides a textual description of constraints on the activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc. null
General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere. null
